Title: CARE - AI based Animal Reidentification Desktop Application (2025)
Description: A cross-platform desktop application helping wildlife researchers identify individual animals from camera trap footage. Redesigned and rebuilt the legacy interface to handle 200,000+ images efficiently, implementing advanced features like drag-and-drop organization, real-time filtering, and batch export capabilities. The app leverages AI models to detect and re-identify animals across thousands of images, making conservation research faster and more accurate.

Title: PodShelf - Podcast Library Web Application (2024)
Description: A full-stack podcast browsing platform enabling users to discover, search, and organize their favorite podcasts and episodes. Built with Flask backend and SQL database, featuring user authentication, dynamic search, and playlist management. Developed as part of an Agile team project using Scrumban methodology.
Technologies: HTML, CSS, Flask, SQLAlchemy ORM, SQLite

Title: NZSL Web Application for Beginners (2024)
Description: An interactive web application designed to help beginners learn New Zealand Sign Language (NZSL). Features a searchable sign dictionary with video demonstrations, community event calendar, and user-contributed guestbook. Built with a custom RESTful API backend in C# and dynamic frontend with vanilla JavaScript.
